note: First National Lockdown. All non- essential high street businesses closed and people ordered to stay home
Requirement  to  be home overnight and people were permitted to meet outside with up to six people
Hospitality businesses were permitted to reopen. Gatherings up to thirty people were legally permitted, although the Government was still recommending people avoid gatherings larger than six
The new rule of six applied in both indoor and outdoor spaces
Pubs, bars and restaurants had to shut between 10pm and 6am
Introduction of the first three tier system
Second National Lockdown. National restrictions reintroduced in England. People could leave home to meet one person from outside their support bubble outside

phase: Phase five: reintroducing a tier system
Phase five: reintroducing a tier system
Phase five: reintroducing a tier system

note: Third National Lockdown. Rules like the rules in the first lockdown.
